lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Aug. 2 -- The spreading of the southern front to the neighborhood of Salsk, 100 miles southeast of Rostov, effectively cuts the last main railroad to the Soviet Black Sea Fleet's bases. It also seriously complicates transport of the grain of the Kuban steppes and the oil of the Maikop fields.
